data.description: Exploring the possibilities of mobile development with React Native. Built a to do app, which is rather simple but includes several concepts used in mobile apps. For example local storage, React Context and use of native features.

Solution to the [Sunnyside agency landing page challenge](https://www.frontendmentor.io/challenges/sunnyside-agency-landing-page-7yVs3B6ef) on Frontend Mentor. This challenge provides mockups and assets. The goal is to build a perfect (working) copy. Great exercise on Flex box layouts, responsiveness and overall CSS properties.

Outsystems demo app to practice Traditional web modules, server backend modules and UI design. Includes the FlowyJS library for creating draggable department organigrams. This way I learned to implement a JS library in the case there is no standard Outsystems component (yet).

Small demo harnessing the power of Google Charts maps, this Outsystems Reactive demo displays the life expectancy per country. The frondend part is rather simple, but shows how Outsystems integrates with current tools to speed up the development process. Credits to akhil for sharing the dataset.
Single-page app, build to practice with React. Makes use of multiple custom React components and ES6 Javascript.
Small project to dive deeper into the usage of [HandlebarsJS](https://handlebarsjs.com/) for templating. An HTML5 form is used to register input and a sparkle of Vanilla JavaScript to make it shine!
Mini-game build to practice Javascript Eventlisteners, functions and interfaces.
